description: In Microsoft Edge, certain policies such as 'ShowMicrosoftRewards', 'LocalBrowserDataShareEnabled', 'WebWidgetAllowed', 'EdgeShoppingAssistantEnabled', and 'HubsSidebarEnabled' may result in an inconsistent user experience. This can manifest as unexpected browser behavior or options being unavailable to users. As these settings are fundamental fixes, they play a critical role in how users interact with Edge and can significantly influence user satisfaction. Misconfiguration or disablement of these policies may lead to missed functionalities or diminished performance in Edge, particularly affecting users who rely on specific features. It’s essential for administrators to be aware of these settings to ensure optimal browser performance and user experience.
